hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via Multi-Timeframe Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regime with BTC trading between 50-day and 200-day SMA, a breakout above 20-day high on >2x average volume that is confirmed by weekly volume >1.5x 20-week average signals valid transition to BULL regime, not false breakout.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral ranges often see false breakouts. Multi-timeframe volume confirmation filters noise: daily spike shows immediate interest, weekly confirms sustained institutional accumulation. Volume delta ensures buying pressure dominance.
entry_conditions: Cumulative Volume Delta positive for breakout week

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price sustains >15% above breakout level for 5 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns below 20-day high and 50-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 15 days without BULL confirmation (failed to hold >5% above breakout)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >65% of volume-confirmed breakouts in neutral regimes fail to sustain gains, with price returning to range within 10 days and volume reverting to average.
